description: Lightweight sandals made from wound cord.  They offer little in the way of protection, but keep you cool during warmer months.
A relatively lightweight pair of leather boots.
A pair of steel-toed rubber boots, the sort worn by firefighters.
Apart from the fasteners and the bits holding the material together, these boots are made entirely from arthropod exoskeleton.
Boots crafted from glassy-looking arthropod exoskeleton.  The material is a little more brittle, but might withstand fire and acid better than the regular stuff.

//: These are not punk rock boots, they're a vague example of typical US army temperate weather boot. Rockers wear boots or steel-toed boots.
description: Solid but surprisingly lightweight boots made from a combination of suede and nylon duck.  Possibly the most important part of a service member's uniform.
Armored foot protectors constructed from steel and Nomex for use by explosive ordnance disposal technicians.
Leather boots, lined with fur for warmth.
Boots made of durable nylon duck with faux fur lining for warmth.
Tough yet light leather boots, intended for outdoor activity.
Leather boots armor-plated with squares of sheet metal.
A pair of rubber work boots, often used while cleaning with caustic materials.
Heavy boots made of chemical-resistant treated leather with steel toecaps.  Great for the jobsite or for stomping the undead
A descendant of the classic steeltoed boot, this modern footwear has become popular amongst working class people over the last couple of decades.
Stiff leather cowboy boots with pointed toes and a low heel.  The wide cuffs could be used as as hoc pockets, or maybe even holsters.
Wool-lined boots designed for warmth.
Sport shoes with hard undersides and studs on the bottom designed to dig into grass.
Snug sport shoes with hard ridges on the bottom.
Known as klompen in the Netherlands and sabots in France, these wooden shoes have endured through the ages due to their simple design and durability.
Gigantic shoes fit for a clown.  They would be very difficult to run in, and fighting in them seems like a terrible idea.
Fancy leather shoes, not designed for running.
Simple sandals.  Somewhat difficult to run in.
These flip-flops are branded with a designer logo.  It does not make them any easier to run in.
Rags tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, but still better than nothing.
Fur pelts tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, but still better than nothing.

name.str: pair of faux fur foot wraps
name.str_pl: pairs of faux fur foot wraps

description: Faux fur patches tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, but still better than nothing.
Leather patches tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, but still better than nothing.
Felt patches tied around your feet.  Not much of an improvement over being barefoot, but still better than nothing.
A pair of Japanese clogs consisting of solid wooden soles and toe straps to hold them on.
A pair of high heeled shoes, impractical for running or fighting.
Boots with a cuff that extends up to the knee.  Their heels are sensibly low, but still don't look terribly suited to running away from monsters during the end of the world.
Custom-made knee-high leather boots issued to motor officers.  Warm, durable and quite tough.
Sturdy leather hiking sandals with a heel strap, suitable for outdoor adventuring in warm weather.
//: weight is based on an average of between 1 and 2 lbs for various hiking sandals IRL.

description: Lightweight shoes made of cloth and rubber.
A type of traditional Native American footwear sewn out of leather.
A type of traditional Native American footwear sewn out of fur.
A pair of durable boots used by dirt bikers and motorcyclists.
A pair of inline skates.  Very fast on flat floors, but they make it hard to move on rough terrain, take hits, or dodge effectively.
An old-fashioned pair of leather rollerskates with steel frames.  While quite fast on flat floors, they make it difficult to take hits or to move on rough terrain.
Simple shoes woven from strips of flexible bark from a birch tree.  They're not especially comfortable, but might be better than going barefoot.
A pair of flat-soled shoes for use in bowling alleys.
Soft indoor shoes that keep your feet warm.  They're not great for much else.
Lightweight cloth shoes with no ties, meant to be worn without socks.
Athletic shoes, designed for running.
Sandals made from straw cordage.  Not very comfortable, but can keep your feet safe.
High-heeled boots that extend all the way up past the knees, these are the sort of thing you would have seen on a stripper or at a halloween party.
A pair of sneakers with integrated wheels hidden in their very thick soles.  Currently the wheels are retracted, making these almost normal lace-up athletic shoes.

A pair of sneakers with integrated wheels, currently the wheels are out, allowing you to swiftly roll around on flat terrain.  You should probably pop them back in before you try fighting or going off-road.

use_action.msg: You pop the wheels back in.

description: Also known as sabatons, these steel boot covers are meant to be strapped on over a pair of shoes.
A snug-fitting pair of stockings made from thin and lightweight Nomex fabric.
Socks.  Put 'em on your feet.
Short socks, commonly used for sports.  These are designed to protect your feet from friction, not temperature.
A pair of disposable plastic bags, adapted to be used as socks.
Cheap socks designed to be worn once and then thrown away.  They keep your feet clean, but are too thin to give any protection.
Warm socks made of wool.
Long socks that reach above the knees.
Six long cotton tubes sized to fit over tentacles and help protect them from the cold.
A pair of black tabi, as worn with traditional Japanese clothes.
A pair of white tabi, as used by martial arts practitioners.
